original_fears: Social anxiety in large lecture halls
current_fears: Panicking about an upcoming career fair
Fear of presenting in front of CS class
current_behaviors: Attending career fair and networking events
current_anxiety_triggers: Career fair and small talk anxiety

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Gregory expressed anxiety about networking events and class presentations, particularly fearing awkward silences and being perceived as a fraud. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested a 3-step approach for networking (prepared questions, limited conversations, breaks), the echo technique for silences, and writing questions on resume copies. For presentations, practicing with smaller groups and focusing on expertise was recommended. 3) Student's response to solutions: Gregory responded positively, refining questions, planning to practice with his roommate, and using sticky notes in his portfolio. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Gregory felt less terrified, more prepared, and confident about not bombing the career fair, showing significant reduction in anxiety.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Freezing up during networking events, 2) Fear of presenting in CS class. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) 3-step networking approach (prepared questions, limited conversations, breaks), 2) Echo technique for conversation lulls, 3) Writing questions on resume copies, 4) Natural break strategies. Student's response: Positive engagement, workshopped specific questions, planned practice with roommate. Evidence of progress: Shifted mindset from 'fraud' to 'researcher,' concrete preparation steps taken, reduced self-deprecation.
